front.title: The 'Imminent' Response Code for the Constrained Application Protocol (CoAP)

section.title: Terminology
section.t: Readers are expected to be familiar with the terms and concepts described in and .

The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in .

section.title: 2.06 Imminent
section.t: A 2.06 (Imminent) response in reply to a GET request indicates that the target resource exists but no representation of the resource is available yet. The Max-Age Option indicates after what time a client should retry its GET request to retrieve the representation. The client MAY observe the resource (see ) to be notified when the representation becomes available.

A 2.06 (Imminent) response in reply to a POST request indicates that the result of processing the request is not available yet, for example, because the server needs longer to process the request than a client is typically willing to wait for a response. The server MAY specify a location using the Location-* options where the result will become available. If the server does not specify a location, the result will become available at the target resource. To receive the result, the client MAY poll or observe the resource at the specified location with a GET request. The Max-Age Option indicates how long the client should wait before making the GET request.

A 2.06 (Imminent) response MAY contain a payload that represents the progress of processing the original POST request or any other status information. The content format of this representation is specified by the Content-Format Option.

A 2.06 (Imminent) response is cacheable, but not validatable. If it contains Location-* options, it invalidates any cached response for the resource at the specified location; otherwise, it invalidates any cached response for the target resource of the request.

As a consequence of being cacheable, a 2.06 (Imminent) response in reply to a POST request makes the POST method temporarily idempotent: until Max-Age expires, any POST request with the same cache-key -- be it from the same client or any another client -- yields the same 2.06 (Imminent) response. (This is the same behavior as for 4.xx and 5.xx error responses in reply to POST requests.)

section.title: Observing Resources
section.t: When a client registers to observe a resource for which no representation is available yet, the server MAY send one or more 2.06 (Imminent) notifications before sending the first 2.05 (Content) or 2.03 (Valid) notification. The possible resulting sequence of notifications is shown in .

Unless the server is not willing to add the client to the list of observers, each 2.06 (Imminent) notification includes an Observe Option with a sequence number as specified in . Otherwise, the registration request falls back to a normal GET request.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: This document adds the 2.06 (Imminent) response code to the "CoAP Response Codes" registry.
